text:
In the test, the ServletContextListener gets the ServletContextEvent before
Filter's initialization.

However, the Servlet 2.3 Specification says:


"public void contextInitialized(ServletContextEvent sce)

     Notification that the web application is ready to process requests."

That seems the contextInitialized method should get the ServletContextEvent
after Filter and Servlets are ready.
creator: jian.cai@sun.com
craig.mcclanahan@sun.com
text:
There are no guarantees in the spec that Filters are initialized prior to the 
application startup event - the only guarantee is that the init() method of an 
individual Filter will be called before that Filter instance is utilized to 
process a request.  The fact that Tomcat 4.0 initializes Filter instances at web 
app startup time is an implementation detail.

In addition, if filters were initialized before listeners, a 
ServletContextAttributesListener would not be notified about any servlet context 
attributes added in a filter's init() method.
